title: Pre-Calculus Comprehensive Final Exam
description: Comprehensive final exam covering all Pre-Calculus content: function analysis, polynomial/rational functions, exponential/logarithmic functions, trigonometry (foundations and advanced), analytic geometry, parametric/polar, vectors, complex numbers, sequences/series, and limits.

assessmentProblems.question: Given f(x) = 3x - 1 and g(x) = √(x + 4): (a) Find (f∘g)(x) and state its domain. (b) Find g⁻¹(x) and verify with g(g⁻¹(x)).
Find all zeros of f(x) = 2x⁴ - 3x³ - 9x² + 12x + 4, given that (x-2) is a factor.
assessmentProblems.answer: Synthetic division by (x-2): 2x⁴-3x³-9x²+12x+4 = (x-2)(2x³+x²-7x-2). Test rational roots of cubic. x=-2: 2(-8)+(-2)²-7(-2)-2 = -16+4+14-2=0 ✓. So (x+2) is a factor. 2x³+x²-7x-2 = (x+2)(2x²-3x-1). Quadratic formula: x=(3±√(9+8))/4=(3±√17)/4. Zeros: x=2, x=-2, x=(3+√17)/4≈1.781, x=(3-√17)/4≈-0.281.

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate without a calculator: (a) sin(11π/6), (b) cos(3π/4), (c) tan(5π/3), (d) csc(2π/3).
For y = -3sin(2x - π/2) + 1, find: amplitude, period, phase shift, midline, and the x-coordinate of the first maximum for x ≥ 0.
assessmentProblems.answer: Rewrite: y = -3sin(2(x-π/4))+1. Amplitude: 3. Period: 2π/2=π. Phase shift: π/4 right. Midline: y=1. For -3sin: maximum occurs when sin=-1, i.e., 2(x-π/4)=-π/2, x-π/4=-π/4, x=0. First maximum at x=0, y=-3(-1)+1=4.

assessmentProblems.question: Verify the identity: (cos2θ)/(1+sin2θ) = (cosθ-sinθ)/(cosθ+sinθ).
assessmentProblems.answer: LHS: cos2θ = cos²θ-sin²θ = (cosθ-sinθ)(cosθ+sinθ). 1+sin2θ = 1+2sinθcosθ = sin²θ+cos²θ+2sinθcosθ = (cosθ+sinθ)². So LHS = (cosθ-sinθ)(cosθ+sinθ)/(cosθ+sinθ)² = (cosθ-sinθ)/(cosθ+sinθ) = RHS ✓.

assessmentProblems.question: Solve on [0, 2π): sin(2x) + sinx = 0.
assessmentProblems.answer: sin(2x)+sinx = 2sinxcosx+sinx = sinx(2cosx+1)=0. sinx=0: x=0, π. 2cosx+1=0 → cosx=-1/2: x=2π/3, 4π/3. Solutions: {0, 2π/3, π, 4π/3}.

assessmentProblems.question: If cos A = -5/13 (A in Q3) and tan B = 3/4 (B in Q3), find the exact value of sin(A - B).
assessmentProblems.answer: A in Q3: sin A = -12/13 (from 5-12-13, both neg in Q3). B in Q3: tan B = 3/4, so opp=3, adj=4 (both neg in Q3 but ratio positive). sin B = -3/5, cos B = -4/5 (from 3-4-5, both neg). sin(A-B) = sinAcosB - cosAsinB = (-12/13)(-4/5) - (-5/13)(-3/5) = 48/65 - 15/65 = 33/65.

assessmentProblems.question: In triangle ABC, a = 14, b = 9, c = 11. Find angle B.
Convert to standard form and identify: 9x² + 4y² + 36x - 24y + 36 = 0. Find center, vertices, foci, and eccentricity.
Eliminate the parameter and identify the curve: x = 3sec(t), y = 2tan(t).
assessmentProblems.answer: sec(t)=x/3, tan(t)=y/2. Use sec²t-tan²t=1: (x/3)²-(y/2)²=1 → x²/9-y²/4=1. Hyperbola, horizontal transverse, center (0,0), a=3, b=2.

assessmentProblems.question: (a) Convert the polar equation r = 4/(2 - cos θ) to rectangular form and identify the conic. (b) Convert (−4, 4) from rectangular to polar coordinates.
Find the vector projection of u = ⟨5, -2⟩ onto v = ⟨3, 6⟩. Then find the work done by force F = ⟨-2, 7⟩ over displacement d = ⟨8, 3⟩.
Find all fourth roots of z = -8 + 8√3 i. Express in rectangular form.
A deposit of $1000 is made at the beginning of each year in an account earning 5% compounded annually. (a) Write a formula for the total amount after n years. (b) Find the amount after 20 years.

answerKeys.pcf-5: Amp 3, period π, phase π/4 right, midline y=1. First max at x=0.
